channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Iranian-Americans react to U.S. airstrike on Iran
item.description: In the U.S., reaction from Iranian-Americans to Saturday's bombings in Iran is a mix of fear and concern. We speak with people in Los Angeles, which has a large population of Iranian-Americans.

item.title: Details emerge about Operation Midnight Hammer
item.description: Dubbed "Operation Midnight Hammer," the American military strikes on nuclear facilities in Iran were complex, with the details closely held.

item.title: Iranians react to strikes on country's nuclear facilities
item.description: Many Iranians are confused and experiencing mixed emotions right now – some hoping the US strikes will bring an end to the hardline regime, others worry it'll start a broader war.

item.title: How politicians in the U.S. are reacting to the Iran strikes.
item.description: The Trump administration is doing a victory lap after a surprise attack on three Iranian nuclear sites Saturday. The White House is also facing pushback from some lawmakers.

item.title: Iran's leadership considers its next move
item.description: Iran's leadership is considering what to do after yesterday's US airstrike.

item.title: Reaction from Israel after U.S. bombing of Iran
item.description: Hadeel Al-Shalchi speaks with Israelis on the morning after the U.S. bombing of Iran; one man said his ruined home was the price for destroying Iran's nuclear program.

item.title: What are the possible spillover effects of the US strike on Iran?
item.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with journalist Robin Wright, who's written extensively on Iranian politics, about what the U.S. strike on Iran could mean for both countries.

item.title: Fifty years after its release, what's the enduring legacy of the film Jaws?
item.description: It's been 50 years since Jaws was released in theaters, changing movies forever.

item.title: Iranian-American writer Kaveh Akbar reflects on art amid war
item.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with Iranian-American writer Kaveh Akbar about how he's processing the U.S. strikes again Iran through writing.

item.title: A Rorschach test for America? Covering the military parade and a No Kings rally on the same day
item.description: Last weekend's military parade and No Kings rallies could be seen as an example of a DIVIDED America… a moment where our differences were placed in pretty stark relief. But reporting from both places on the same day… you see something different.
